intro: Watsonia marginata, commonly known as the Natal grassblume, is a striking South African plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It features tall, sword-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-like flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant is native to the coastal regions of KwaZulu-Natal and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to full sun exposure. Watsonia marginata is also valued for its resilience and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
